newsitem.title: USA: CBOT corn closes higher on Iowa crop tour results.
newsitem.headline: CBOT corn closes higher on Iowa crop tour results.

text.p: CBOT corn futures closed higher on late local short covering and commission house buying tied to bullish input from a crop tour of eastern Iowa, traders said.
Crop scouts said northeastern Iowa corn ears were small and soybean pod counts were low.
"Once that came out we took off," said Vic Lespinasse of Dean Witter Reynolds.
The scouts said Iowa corn and soybean fields sampled in one northeastern route of the Professional Farmers of America tour were better than fields seen in Illinois and Indiana.
But corn ears were small and soy pod counts were low, they said. Tour groups on other routes in eastern Iowa and Minnesota painted a similar scenario, they said.

"Last year was also a late year but by this time it was starting to catch up," said Weather Services Corp president Peter Leavitt, a 20-year tour veteran. "This is the latest I've seen it in Illinois and Iowa."
Corn ended steady to up 1-1/4 cents a bushel, with September up 1-1/4 at $3.67-1/2. December rose 3/4 to $3.38-1/2.
SAK Futures bought two million bushels of December, LIT america sold three million December and Cargill Inc sold two million September, they said.
Corn futures volume was estimated at 42,000 contracts, down from 42,701 Wednesday, according to the CBOT.
In the corn options pit Smith Barney was a key buyer of 500 December 290 Puts at 2-1/4 cents.
Corn options volume was estimated at 12,000 contracts, down from 19,296 Wednesday.
